rev.desc.rev.desc: Upgrade Utility: Set Renamed ScriptLibrary with HPE Proprietary to Replaced during upgrade
When load upgrade hotfix, add the scriptlibrary name to skip list in upgradeconfiguration
The dbdict itself should not be changed when uploading the other dbdict unl file
update panel set.file.key, update code to:
if ($flk=8 or $flk=12 or $flk=28 or $flk=40 or $flk=44) then ($key.selected=true;$file.key=$fli)
update panel fcreate.add & dbdict.key.transfer, move primary key to the first key
export a dbidct with primary key to a system which desn't support primary key mode.
update panel start, read.descriptor.record, fcreate.add, add panel dbdict.key.transfer
Don't do a wopen when running in background.
DE4291 Fix how the sql merge happens.
Handle SQL mapping as part of the load.
Handle keys as part of the load.
Reordered the panels from:
merge.dbdict > update.dbdict.record > sql.changes > compare.dbdicts
to:
merge.dbdict > sql.changes > update.dbdict.record > compare.dbdicts
Removed previous two changes due to improved solution to the reocurring password encryption issue.
Sets $G.is.operator.file.load on start panel, and cleans up the variable on the cleanup panel.
updated for Devtx I1849. Sets $G.is.operator.file.load variable so that if the operator record is loaded in, the password length check will be ignored.
Panel decide.file.type
Changed substr() to substrb()
Panel msg.skips
Added $fl.full.pathname to the scmsg parameters as the 2nd parameter.
rebound the error exit on msg.code.flushed, cannot.connect.msg

loading displayoptions from a 6.0 system to a 6.1 system was not working correctly...got duplicate key errors. It turned out that the $L.system.file variable was not getting cleared out. Corrected this by adding a process panel after init.system with the following expression:
$L.system.file.save=contents($L.system.file)
and a process before the add.record.project.1 panel with the following expression:
contents($L.system.file)=$L.system.file.save
This clears out the $L.system.file variable and prevents the duplicate key error.
changed logic so that dbdicts will get deleted if the unload specificies that it should.
panel: process.tag
changed expression:
$L.delete.filename=substr($L.tag, 1, $L.di)
to
$L.filetype=substr($L.tag, 1, $L.di)
This gets the first part of the tag which is the actual type of file...in this case 'dbdict'
added expression:
if ($L.filetype="dbdict") then ($L.delete.filename=substr($L.tag, $L.di+2, lng($L.tag)))
This pulls out the name of the actual dbdict to delete. Originally, any dbdict deletes would result in an attempt to delete the 'dbdict' dbdict.
panel: check.fremove
changed condition for the 'fremove.file' exit from:
same($L.delete.filename, "dbdict")
to
same($L.filetype, "dbdict")
panel: init.delete.file
changed filename from
$L.delete.filename
to
$L.filetype
Changed delete header to 203 to support unicode.
Added delete processing capability for differential upgrade.
Will not use the local init panel if loading dbdicts.
Modified to update SQL mappings when updating a dbdict.
Replaced the process panel update.file.1 with a project panel so that all fields in the dbdict dbdict will be brought over.
Added parameter that can be used to suppress messages.
Don't try to select record if no key was found.
When in add mode select the record. Don't add if record found.
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
Added special case in key selection for displayevent and displayoption records - don't use the first key if it starts with unique.id.
Still more corruption prevention code
additional safety check code to prevent dbdict corruption during load
Shouldn't corrupt dbdict records anymore (always a bonus)

descript.descript: Upgrade Utility: Set Renamed ScriptLibrary with HPE Proprietary to Replaced during upgrade
When load upgrade hotfix, add the scriptlibrary name to skip list in upgradeconfiguration
The dbdict itself should not be changed when uploading the other dbdict unl file
update panel set.file.key, update code to:
if ($flk=8 or $flk=12 or $flk=28 or $flk=40 or $flk=44) then ($key.selected=true;$file.key=$fli)
update panel fcreate.add & dbdict.key.transfer, move primary key to the first key
export a dbidct with primary key to a system which desn't support primary key mode.
update panel start, read.descriptor.record, fcreate.add, add panel dbdict.key.transfer
Don't do a wopen when running in background.
DE4291 Fix how the sql merge happens.
Handle SQL mapping as part of the load.
Handle keys as part of the load.

to:

updated for Devtx I1849. Sets $G.is.operator.file.load variable so that if the operator record is loaded in, the password length check will be ignored.

Changed substr() to substrb()

Added $fl.full.pathname to the scmsg parameters as the 2nd parameter.
rebound the error exit on msg.code.flushed, cannot.connect.msg

$L.system.file.save=contents($L.system.file)
and a process before the add.record.project.1 panel with the following expression:

This gets the first part of the tag which is the actual type of file...in this case 'dbdict'

This pulls out the name of the actual dbdict to delete. Originally, any dbdict deletes would result in an attempt to delete the 'dbdict' dbdict.

changed condition for the 'fremove.file' exit from:

to

changed filename from
$L.delete.filename
to
$L.filetype
Changed delete header to 203 to support unicode.
Added delete processing capability for differential upgrade.
Will not use the local init panel if loading dbdicts.
Modified to update SQL mappings when updating a dbdict.
Replaced the process panel update.file.1 with a project panel so that all fields in the dbdict dbdict will be brought over.
Added parameter that can be used to suppress messages.
Don't try to select record if no key was found.
When in add mode select the record. Don't add if record found.
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
Added special case in key selection for displayevent and displayoption records - don't use the first key if it starts with unique.id.
Still more corruption prevention code
additional safety check code to prevent dbdict corruption during load
Shouldn't corrupt dbdict records anymore (always a bonus)
